section.names: parse\ an\ existing\ model\ from\ a\ file actions_parse_model
section.title: Parse an existing Model from a file
section.paragraph: The following code will read a file called sine_comparison.cellml and deserialise its contents into a Model instance.

Note that both the Parser class and its opposite number, the Printer class, deal with strings rather than files. Youâ€™ll need to read the file into a string, and then use the string as input to the Parser item.

container.paragraph: Parse a model from a CellML file

container.classes: ui bottom attached sphinx-tab tab segment sphinx-data-tab-0-0 active
ui bottom attached sphinx-tab tab segment sphinx-data-tab-0-1
container.literal_block:
# Parse the model from a CellML file.
# Create a libCellML Parser, and use it to parse the fileContents # string and convert it into a CellML Model structure. read_file = open("resources/simulationExample.cellml", "r") parser = Parser() model = parser.parseModel(read_file.read()) print_issues_to_terminal(parser)
